block.p: The Times is changing its daily financial tables, replacing the six existing pages with two pages of analytical tools and summary information on the markets and the economy.

As part of a continuing effort to integrate The Times and its Web version, online readers will be able to choose from an array of new functions, including a host of interactive graphics. Today's Sector Snapshot chart can be found on Page C10.
Readers will also be able to receive closing prices of their stocks and mutual funds by e-mail and will be able to receive midday alerts about sharp price shifts or business news that affects them.
Full financial tables will continue to appear in the Sunday newspaper, covering stocks, bonds, mutual funds and foreign markets.
Comments about the changes may be e-mailed to tables@nytimes.com or telephoned to (212) 556-3715.
